Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> with random amounts to each

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <ITM> so let say you send to 10,
I will not know anything until all 10 outputs are spend

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> which is hard

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> because one user will hodl

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> so I can not proof the 10 dependency

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> so if there is one output to a hodl address that is never spent, it seems to make it more difficult

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> now I have 4 people never spend, which one is it link to, we will never know until one of the 4 spends it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> so people doing atomic swaps will need a hodl address where some funds are sent to with each transaction

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> maybe that is much simpler to implement and has a bigger deterrent effect

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> since the note has no proofing, so all the others I attempt to associate will return invalid proof

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> can just be 0.0001 sent to a hodl address with each transaction

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> :shush:

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> when will you publish something about your fantastic zcash deanonymizer?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> i assume mimblewimble is childs play to deanon, since all the tx are in plaintext before it is mined

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <ITM> Soon, I trying to get a small setup and paper. Just to show the first 100k blocks(or 6 months data)
So people can actually improve upon the research and maybe even come up with better solutions.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> I only get weekends to work on it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> it can be invalid or incorrect, but it something

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> having actual percentages of each chain deanoymized would be very interesting, i assume DASH is not having any actual privacy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> XMR has 0 privacy lol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> DM me a PIRATE address, I will send you a donation

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> oh, if XMR has 0% privacy, i guess PIRATE is the only hope for any actual privacy

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> XMR you use elimination, there increase it to 12+ I think now. But the problem is I can inject on transaction, I will know my inputs and outputs. So the entire block can be easily reverse

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> if my outputs > the rest in the current block, its simple task

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> it was publish and spoken many times

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ITM> but XMR then decided to do something like bulletproofs to reduce xmr size which actually made it easier for elimination

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã> would be nice to see article showing how much effort/money/infrastructure is needed to deanonimize popular privacy protocols with examples and link to block explorers, so that nobody can say "not proven" + some resume for avg users so that they understand the implications of this

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> i think the implication is that only PIRATE has a chance of remaining private

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã> posted some of your talk on reddit here (wonder if XMR guys will answer that ) https://www.reddit.com/r/CryptoCurrency/comments/d59dbw/what_monero_has_done_in_the_past_6_months/

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <ca333> `ITM made the first way to extract information out of ztransactions, even z->z !` excellent - i wasn't aware of his findings. Depending on the of extractable info we could probably utilize it to visualize the data for the less techincal crowd - i am sure many parties would find value in this. It would also be a great presentation on why PIRATE provides real privacy as opposed to hybrid implementations.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @ITM @jl777c wow, that is a lot of amazing backlog I just read about de-anon techniques

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @ca333 the idea for the company Chainanalysis supposedly started because somebody was giving a talk about deanonymizing BTC and somebody in the audience said "I will pay for this, make it"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c what was said above, if it works, is the makings of a profitable company

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Doing it at scale, doing it "right"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @ITM you are now the first Hush Czar of Deanonymization

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã> beware now ECC got 1 more arg for new funding

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I have been thinking of how to fight-deanon stuff, and I think there are some pro-active things ARRR+HUSH can do. Activities which increase the cost and reduce the data quality in the de-anon process

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã> does these findings impact Hush encrypted msgs ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c allowing z=>t with a single taddr output is probably the worst offender. If a user always adds dummy zaddr outputs, i.e. never do a z=>t with just a single taddr output, I think the analysis gets much harder if a user does that. I believe both of you touched on that above. Pirate doesn't allow z=>t normally, but I hear talk about swapping pirate, so something like that will be done.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã what we are talking about doesn't break the encryption of memo fields, but it does reduce the privacy of zaddrs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> i dont think it matters much, the z->t and t->z just contaminates any involved zaddr, you need to treat it as a taddr level

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> it is so bad that even the zaddrs only involved in z->z are affected and i think if that is mitigated, it makes it acceptable

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã> only 1 additional 0.0001 z tx is enough or the more the better ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> The initial t=>z gives a lower bound of how much funds are in a zaddr, and then the attacker can gain more info with more metadata analysis

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> only 1 is enough as far as i know, as long as that one is NEVER spent

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã> 1e-4 additional small deflation

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> What ITM is saying, is that an attacker can do a simulation and extract, with high probability, information about zaddrs that should not be possible

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> any spending tree can be tagged with amounts, if it is involved with taddr

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> yes, upper and lower bounds for the amount in each zaddr

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> so the spending graph is derivable. which without amounts is interesting, but doesnt divulge too much

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> once you can tag a txid of having a specific amount, that amount can be traced through its spending graph

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> The spending graph can also be correlated to completely outside data, i.e somebody maybe mentioning on Twitter they bought something for a certain price

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Not easy to automate, but still that is there

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> nothing you do will mitigate the z->t, or the t->z, it is basically a known amount

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Agree on that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> so the critical thing is to have z->z that is after that, but with never spent outputs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that *is* quite critical

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> for any chain other than PIRATE, it is not really mattering though as all other chains are basically deanonymized

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and I don't think this is well-known

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c well, on HUSH, we plan to extensively use amount=0 xtns, and I believe that will confuse amount analysis thoroughly. It doesn't change the spending graph

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c we could actually have Pirate + Hush wallets act on this information, and make unspent zaddr outputs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> with rampant z-> t and t->z, it will very very hard to get any privacy at all

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c we don't force z=>t=>z either

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we inherited how KMD used to work

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> HUSH really is quite similar to the old KMD with zaddrs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> it seems not worth to fix for non-PIRATE chains as i dont see a way to mitigate the reverse proofing attack

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> well, at least ITM is on our side

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and Hush is a good playground to see what we can do against the "reverse-proofing attack"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <mrlynch> catching up...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c i am definitely thinking about giving some warnings to users in GUI wallets when they do a z=>t, explaining the metadata leakage. It's really not obvious to most users. And Hush SilentDragon has shielded change enabled by default

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Small things, but better than nothing

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @mrlynch it's a lot of backlog, good luck

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c i have been thinking about how this really affects Hush, which is focused on communications and the memo field

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> In that light, this deanon issue does not concern our main use case

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> correct, but the spending graph will be revealed, so what address is talking to what address would be leaked...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> i guess HUSH should mitigate also. add a 0.0001 output to a nonspendable zaddr to each ztx

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c hmmm, always adding a 0.0001 output to yourself is a reasonable hack and doesn't burn money

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> no, not to yourself as when it is spent, it is deanonymized

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> yeah, I get that, but on average, it will not be spent

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It's about breaking the analysis, on average

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> people that maintain their wallet and consolidate funds, WILL spend all the zutxos

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If Hush SilentDragon always sends an extra zaddr output of 0.0001 to myself, at least sometimes that will be unspent and break the analysis. Sometimes it won't. We could also tell the user "Do you want to burn an extra 0.0001 per transaction for extra privacy?"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but most people will just do the default

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> yes, default to burning an extra 0.0001

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that means after 10,000 * 21,000,000 xtns, there is no more Hush

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we have a fixed supply, not like KMD, where the above would be fine

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we could burn a tinier amount, yes?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 1sat zaddr burns?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Who knew you had to destroy zfunds to make them safe, lol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Sending to an unspendable address does not seem viable as a chain-wide default

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> As an optional setting per-user, yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but that doesn't really solve the problem

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @jl777c this is a bit of a hack, but hear me out

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <denio> Should this tx rly burn or just a long time unused is also OK?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> If users could make an isolated wallet.dat, which holds these funds, they could be somewhat sure they don't accidentally spend them. So, users would make a wallet.dat, and get a zaddr from it. Then, their normal wallet sends little tiny output to that other wallet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> That other wallet should not be used normally

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Occasionally, it can be swept

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it is at least a process to follow. Not very nice for users, but GUI wallets could help automate it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <jl777c> as soon as it is spent, it can be traced

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> on average
